content.title: Fall in love with the starting line
content.excerpt: Holding on to the identity that we have narrated to ourselves- is rather obvious. Whenever we are put in the position of start over- there is a lot of friction which further reflects in the slowness of an organization at accepting change.

content.title: The universal reach of creating
content.excerpt: Recently, I have pivoted into the role of Product manager and wow, the clich√©s about my role are popping up left and right, turning into real conversations! One being that Product manager and Project manager are the same- the janitors and herders of people.

content.title: Why are we living longer but feeling worse
content.excerpt: The Paradox of Longevity: What if living to 85, like the average Japanese citizen, means spending your last decade unwell? At Eurotox 2025, George P. Chrousos unveiled a striking paradox: we're gaining years but losing vitality. Could mastering stress hold the key?

content.title: Ego control and sincerity in pharma science: an epistemological dissection
content.excerpt: Sometimes, when I notice carefully, the environment in Pharma, I realize than more than being about truth, the entire industry is about memes. Step inside any scientific team, alongside lab protocols and data dashboards, subtler games are a part of the scenario.

content.title: Paper2Agent: Reimagining Research Papers
content.excerpt: Exploring how research papers can be transformed into interactive and reliable AI agents.

content.title: LLMs for Data Extraction in Toxicology
content.excerpt: Implications and lessons learned from using LLMs in toxicology data extraction.
